para.dtcname: SRS Warning Light does not Come ON

content5.ptxt: The SRS warning light is located on the combination meter. When the SRS is normal, the SRS warning light illuminates for approximately 6 seconds after the ignition switch is turned from OFF to ON, and then turns OFF automatically. If there is a malfunction in the SRS, the SRS warning light illuminates to inform the driver. When terminals TC and CG of the DLC3 are connected, the DTCs are communicated through SRS warning light blinking patterns.
Refer to "SRS Warning Light Remains ON" (see page ).

atten2.ptxt: Be sure to perform the following procedures before troubleshooting to avoid unexpected airbag deployment.

item.ptxt: After turning the ignition switch off, waiting time may be required before disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal. Therefore, make sure to read the disconnecting the cable from the battery terminal notice before proceeding with work (See page ).
When disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal while performing repairs, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal, and wait for at least 90 seconds.
Disconnect the connector from the center airbag sensor.
Disconnect the connector from the steering pad.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal, and wait for at least 90 seconds.
Check that the connectors are properly connected to the center airbag sensor and combination meter.
Measure the voltage of the wire harness side connector.
Disconnect the A14 ECU connector with the C20 meter connector connected.
Check that the warning light illuminates 10 seconds after turning the ignition switch ON.

specitem.ptxt: Warning light illuminates 10 seconds after turning ignition switch ON.

test1.ptxt: Check that the SRS warning light illuminates normally.
